name: Sprouts (Danstarr13)
description:
Sprouts

A game originally invented by mathematicians John Horton Conway and Michael S. Paterson at Cambridge University in the early 1960s. I've decided to attempt to re-create my own version of the game in a fully 3-dimensional world.

You can move the camera with W, A, S, D and zoom in and out with the scroll wheel.

The rules are simple.

Select the number of starting sprouts (currently a max of 4) and your oppenents AI difficulty level.

Flip a coin to see who goes first.

During your turn, draw a line between two exising sprouts on the map.

Choose where to create a new sprout somewhere along that line.

Each sprout can have no more than 3 connections.

Lines cannot cross eachother.

Last one to draw a line wins.

Good luck...
